column4: when i unpluge my ethernet cable and i go to the top icon for network connections
all is says is manual configuration
it doesn't list your router in the list?
when i unpluge my ethernet cable, how do i make my internet connect wirelessly, or should it automatically?
what do you mean?
the network icon in the corner doesn't list the available wireless networks?
no not when i unplug my ethernet cable, and i have the updated driver for my wireless card
when you right click the icon you do have Enable Wireless checked correct?
when i right click it has "enable networking" checked and nothing else shows up
any ideas on what to do??
you're wireless card isn't enabled at the moment somehow, what type of card do you have?
a broadcom card that i have the driver downloaded and installed for, how do i enable it?
is the module currently loaded?
how do i tell?
does it show up with the lsmod command?
im a novice with terms like that, how do i tell?
do you know the name of the module for your wireless card that you installed?
you mean the driver? it was like rev 02 bla bla bla and im prety sure i installed it correctly
under my restricted drivers it says firmware for my broadcom 43xx chipset family is in use

ok will you need to open a terminal and run "lsmod" and see if the driver you installed is in the list. If it's not you need to try and load it with "modprobe <drivername>" I can't help you find the driver name
also when you run "iwconfig" in a terminal does it list anything besides lines with "No wireless extensions"
1 sec
